intro: Bracea bahamensis, commonly known as the Bahamian brash, is a flowering plant native to the Bahamas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
